SAM WITTY

Graduate Student Researcher

I'm a second year computer science M.S./Ph.D. candidate working with David Jensen in the Knowledge Discovery Laboratory at UMass Amherst. I spend my time thinking about problems in machine learning and causality, with a particular focus on probabilistic programming and explainable artificial intelligence. I'm also passionate about expanding the role of computation in scientific discovery and public policy.

Earlier in my career I built models of brain aneurysms, and used machine learning and statistics to improve building energy efficiency. You can read about these in more detail in my CV.

I'm always interested in collaborating on machine learning problems in academia or in industry, so please feel free to send me an email if you'd like to talk.

In the rare moments when I'm not reading/writing/talking about data, you're likely to find me lost in the woods. All of the photos on this site were taken by my good friend on a three-day expedition into Sequoia National Forest.
